column2: See it soon as it may be moving
column3: A landmark on Venice Beach since 2001, it is a fine work by Mark di Suvero. Over 18 metres high it comprises two large intertwined V shapes, one inclined towards the city and the other pointing seawards.Installed to mark the Venice Art Walk it was intended to be in place for six months. However 18 years later it continues to attract the attention of passers-by.But that may be about to change. There are reports that by yearâ€™s end it may be disassembled and relocated to the artist's studio. So see it soon.
